ref: 5903 *tūrtha ʻ ford, crossing, landing place ʼ. [~ tīrthá -- . -- &rcirclemacr Pk. tūha -- n. ʻ ford ʼ, in cmpd. -- utthiya -- ʻ belonging to a philosophical school ʼ; Aś.top. tuṭhāyatanāni ʻ abodes of suitable recipients ʼ (rather than < tuṣṭa -- , tuṣṭy -- ); Kho. thūrt ʻ ford ʼ (→ Kal.rumb. thūrt, Phal. turt NOPhal 50); Or. tuṭha, toṭha ʻ ford, landing or bathing place ʼ; Si. toṭa ʻ ford, ferry, landing place ʼ. -- Deriv. Si. toṭiyā ʻ ferryman ʼ; toṭu ʻ heretical ʼ formed from toṭa after MIA. *tuṭṭhaya -- beside *tuṭṭha -- as Sk. tīrthaka -- beside tīrthá -- .
